txt.en: The tales of old speak of goblins, bats, and Wargs loyal to an ancient Orc-lord who ruled Mount Gundabad. It is said that his wickedness was so great that it drew all manner of foul creatures to the surrounding lands, not the least of which are the vicious wolves that have long troubled the River Hobbits of Misthallow. Has such a thing come to pass yet again? Do new evils stir in the North? Whatever the truth of it, it seems an ill omen that now wolves can be found across nearly all of Middle-earth.

Wolves? Orcs? Dark Powers? Well, if that is what is meant to be, then that is what will beâ€”but you have got mettle enough to see it through, and you wager that any would-be Lord of Gundabad or self-styled Dark Lord will get a fair bit more than he bargained for if he sets his eyes on the hardy River Hobbits of Misthallow.

The wolves are everywhere these days. Perhaps the greedy creatures' hunts have borne little fruit in recent days, leaving them no choice but to seek for new prey in more distant lands. You would think that if they had the slightest sense at all, they would head back up North to the plentiful lands of the Vales of Anduin. On second thought, perhaps it would be better if they did not trouble the River Hobbits more than they already do!
